title: Grilled Summer Fruit
introduction: Grilled summer fruits are the perfect accompaniment to any barbecue, infusing fresh flavors with a hint of smokiness. Serve them plain or dress them up with slices of sponge cake and a scoop of ice cream for a delightful treat that captures the essence of summer.
instructions: 1. Place a barbecue grill or broiler rack about 5 inches away from the heat source. Preheat the grill or broiler.
2. Alternate pieces of the fruits with the mint leaves on 6 skewers. Sprinkle with the sugar.
3. Grill or broil the fruit for 3 minutes on one side. Turn the skewers and grill or broil until lightly browned, about 2 minutes more. Serve hot.
